snippet: Now that Munch’s famous image has set a price record, it may be a while before we look at it and see only the familiar existential dread.
abstract: Editorial on Edvard Munch's 1895 pastel The Scream bringing nearly $120 million, the highest auction price ever paid for a work of art; suggests that now that the piece has moved to the top of art's 10-most-wanted list, it will be a while before one can look at the work and see only the old, familiar existential dread.
lead_paragraph: Now that Munch’s famous image has set a price record, it may be a while before we look at it and see only the familiar existential dread.
